column1: Malinga slings it into the thigh of Finch, 131.3ks, he shuffles across and does not connect with a flick
back of a length on off, 132.5ks, Finch jumps off the ground and fends the ball to short midwicket
back of a length on off, 134.3ks, Malinga has Finch hopping and skipping again. Punched down to mid-on for one
full and veering into the pads, 135.9ks, Klinger picks it off through square leg and gets off the mark
back of a length on off, skids on, 134.3ks, the bat thuds into the splice twice. The ball rolls to cover
slower one - 115.1ks - half-volley outside off, Klinger waits on it and square-drives it away
just short of a good length and outside off, Klinger leans back and cuts it straight to backward point
Klinger uses his feet, Kulasekara pulls his length back on off. Klinger check-pushes it to cover
short and outside off, Finch stands up tall and punches the ball crisply, but can't beat extra cover
Finch backs away outside the leg stump, this is a yorker on off stump. Finch manages to dig the ball out to cover
thigh-high full-toss, Finch does not need any second invitations. He goes over the top of short midwicket and beats mid-on to his right. Duly put away
back of a length and slanted in, flicked to the deep with the angle
back of a length and angled in straight, maneuvered to short fine leg on the back foot
back of a length and angled in on middle, 126.1ks, clipped away to deep square leg
Klinger uses his feet, does not meet the pitch of this back of a length ball, and pokes to cover. He looks for a quick single, it isn't there
back of a length and skids through outside off, Klinger aims for swish across the line, but does not connect
shot. A whirl of the wrists sends the ball to the wide long-on fence. A bit too full and outside off, whipped away to the left of diving short midwicket
back of a length on off, punchily played to cover
108ks slower ball on off, the batsman backs away outside leg and jabs to mid-off. Sandakan, I think, tidies up
overpitched on middle, drilled to mid-off. Finch chances a single and makes it. SL needed a direct hit to make it tight
just short of a good length on off, Klinger makes room by stepping away outside leg. Pushed to mid-off again
full and angled in on off, flicked away to midwicket for one

just clears Tharanga at mid-off. Kulasekara slips in the slower ball from the back of the hand on the leg stump, Klinger, having backed away outside leg, manufactures enough pace and hoists it over a leaping mid-off
Kulasekara follows the slower one with a yorker, which is squeezed away through square leg
back of a length on off, tucked away past midwicket. Asela runs back, chases, and hunts it down
pretty full and angled in on off stump, Finch uses his wrists, picks the ball up in the air between wide mid-on and midwicket
hip-high short ball on off, you've got to get it up higher, swivels on the back foot and pulls it square of short fine leg and fine of deep square leg. Top placement, Klinger
full and too leg-stumpish, tickled away fine of short fine leg now. Back-to-back boundaries with minimal fuss
back of a length and outside off, gently worked to midwicket
slower incutter, 94ks, bunted to the midwicket region
Finch steps away outside leg, the bowler follows him, chopped to cover
leg-side wide, breaking down leg
tossed up on off, held up in the pitch, defended to cover
Klinger uses his feet, this slides in with the arm, Klinger does not meet the pitch and is rapped on the pad. But it was sliding down leg
worked to midwicket
backs away outside leg and biffs it to the covers
non-turning legbreak outside off, pushed back to the bowler. Good over from Prasanna
short and skids on outside off, sits back and forces a single to long-off
another non-turning short ball outside off, back-foot chop to point
pushed through, spins away outside off, punched to long-off. Fifty opening stand for Australia. Good platform to launch from
fired outside off, punched on the back foot through cover again
tossed up and spins in on off, patted to wide long-on
flatter and darted in, Klinger can't work it away to leg
tossed-up legbreak, down the track and drilled to long-off
full on middle, Finch backs away outside leg, manufactures room, and drives firmly through the covers
Klinger is floored. He feigned to make room, Prasanna lobs it up wide outside off, just on the guideline is it? Not too sure. Harsh call, off-side wide, and Klinger sneaks across to the other end
low full-toss on the leg stump, Finch jabs it with the bottom hand to the right of long-on
Finch steps away outside leg, the bowler follows him, hit to long-on. 1000 runs for Finch in T20Is, he is the second fastest to the milestone behind Kohli
tossed up full on off, goes low and sweeps a single to long leg
skips down the track, aims for the loft, ends up toe-ending the googly over cover. Sanjaya fumbles running in from the deep
dropped shortish and outside off, slammed to long-off on the back foot. Sanjaya makes no mistake here, gets behind the ball
full and slides on outside off, forced to cover
short and spins away outside off, beats the cut
uses his feet, meets a half-volley, and whips to deep midwicket
pushed through outside off, down the track and cracked to long-off
Finch feigns to reverse cover-drive it through cover (for a left-hander) and does not connect
Finch now attempts a big slog-sweep and does not make contact
Finch backs away outside leg, dangled up wide outside off, skewed back to the bowler
dropped short on leg stump, Finch backs away and hammers it straight down the ground for a six, the first of the evening. Sailed towards the sightscreen
back of a length and turns away outside off, chopped to point
speared outside off, Finch eyes up the leg side with a slog-sweep and does not make contact. The ball grazes the pad and rolls away fine on the off side

wrong'un, full on off stump, Klinger looks to slog it over the leg side. He did not pick the wrong'un I guess. Wanted to heave over the leg side, and ended up slicing an outside edge in the air. Malinga ventured in from point and clasped it, sliding on his knees
pitched up on middle and leg, tapped to wide long-on with soft hands
spins in and takes the pad as Head plays down the wrong line
hung up in the air outside off, wrong'un, Head does not pick it. Swishes and misses. Dickwella swipes the bails off, but Head's back foot is grounded in time
When Finch hits, it stays hit. He greets Asela with a mighty six. Length ball on middle, clouted powerfully over midwicket
back of a length offcutter, swiped in the air between deep square leg and deep midwicket

Malinga tracks down this skier, running in from short fine leg. Slower offcutter from Asela, Finch swipes early and sends a top-edge in the air. Smart catch from Malinga. Two catches in two overs for him. SL slowing Australia down
slower cutter on leg stump, knocked to midwicket with soft hands
very full and outside off, shovelled away to long-on for one
full and around off, whipped away to wide long-on

Tharanga drops a sitter at point. He wears a sheepish smile. Dropped short and outside off, think it's a googly. Head chops it in the air on the back foot. Pops in and pops out. Could have been three wickets in three overs. 'Good time to drop a catch' says Justin Langer, who is miked-up
slides outside off, driven to sweeper cover
knocked to midwicket from a straightish line
flatter and outside off, flashed to backward point. Straight to Tharanga
tossed outside off, driven down the ground
full and angled into the pads, worked into the vacant spaces in the leg side
116.8 dipping full-toss on off, nurdled to mid-on
full and slung down the leg side, past the attempted flick
another slow dipping full-toss on off, 110.7ks, tapped down the ground
seam-up half-volley outside off, Head loft-drives the ball over extra-cover
full and outside off, driven on the front foot to long-off
very full on middle, push-driven to long-off
full-toss drops on Head on and around off, swiped away past midwicket to wide long-on
pushed through on leg stump, Head brings out his favourite slog-sweep and hits the ball to deep midwicket
Sanjaya runs in from deep cover, attacks it, but the ball drops in front of him. Googly outside off, Henriques does not meet the pitch, chips in the air over the infield and gets away
slides outside off, drilled down the ground
flighted outside off, Henriques races down the track, gets close to the pitch now and wallops it straight over the bowler's head. Takes it from outside off and nails it
tossed-up googly outside off,  uses his feet, does not pick it. Slices an outside edge between backward point and short third man
Head backs away outside leg, the bowler follows him, slugged away powerfully towards deep midwicket. Siriwardana initially over-ran the ball, but pulls it in near the boundary

First international wicket for Sanjaya! Length ball on off, Henriques can't clear the long boundary. #MCGisbig. Holes out to Kapu at long-on. The shot was on, but the execution was bad, with the bat twisting in Henriques' hands
very full and outside off, Head shimmies out and drives to long-off
97.2 slower ball into the pads, dabbed with soft hands in front of long-on

Sanjaya nails a yorker on off stump, the batsman digs it back to the bowler. Sanjaya dives to his right and deflects the ball in front of him. The Australians sneak a single. Sanjaya dishes out another dive, swoops down on the ball, but can't throw it onto the stumps
slower one outside off, dragged away to wide long-on
very full and wide outside off, past the tramline. Off-side wide
slower ball outside off,  Head picks it and dispatches over the long boundary. Slugged disdainfully over midwicket. The wide hurts Sanjaya
very full on middle stump, clipped away through midwicket. They hustle back for the second
Malinga spears a yorker on middle stump, swings in. Turner still gets a four. He jabs his bat down and squeezes it square of short fine leg. Streaks away to the boundary
leg-stump full-toss, whipped to square leg
full-toss on off, shovelled away with the bottom hand to wide mid-on
yorker on the leg stump, dug out to midwicket
full-toss outside off, flat-batted away to long-off running in
length ball outside off, Head swings hard, loses his shape in the process. Ends up dragging the ball to midwicket
chest-high short ball on off, short-arm flapped away to midwicket

really full and shading outside leg stump, past the flick. Not a leg-side wide. Called a no-ball by umpire Wilson because third man or backward point was outside the circle when the ball was bowled. Just three fielders were inside
short on the leg stump, swatted away to deep midwicket
full-toss outside off,slashed to deep point
yorker on leg stump, jammed to long-on
yorker outside off, jabbed to point, a fumble allows a single
yorker on the leg stump, forced away to deep square leg. Slipshod throw from Prasanna after stopping the ball. The ball plinks a few metres in front of him. He then cleans up the mess
yorker on the leg stump, jabbed towards midwicket
full on leg stump, clears his front leg, and unleashes a clubbing swing to the left of long-on

First wicket for Malinga on return. Holes out to Prasanna, who makes no mistake this time. Head backs away outside leg stump, this is speared full and wide outside off. Head reaches out and nails it to the fielder

Two in two for Malinga and Prasanna. The fielder lets out a roar. Malinga attempts a yorker, comes out as a full-toss on the leg stump. Turner swings and Prasanna runs to his right from deep midwicket to pouch it
really full on off, Faulkner whips it away through midwicket
Faulkner steps out, Kulasekara goes shorter and outside off. The batsman upper-cuts it over backward point
banged in short again, this lifter beats the attempted hook
down the track and whipped away to wide long-on. There is a direct hit at the non-striker's end but Paine is in
full-toss down the leg side, wide

pretty full on off stump, forced away to long-on. Paine walks off. Faulkner and Paine risk the double. Kulasekara collects the throw and breaks the stumps. Paine dishes out a full-length dive, but is caught short. He knew he was out. Exits for a duck without facing a ball
low-full toss on leg stump, whipped away through backward square leg. Faulkner rushes back for the second

Faulkner dances out, meets a full-toss, and pumps it over midwicket. Deep midwicket (think Prasanna) runs in, the dives to his left and makes a royal mess of it. Did not even get his finger-tip to it. Kulasekara is consoled by Shanaka. Faulkner finishes the innings with a boundary
length ball on leg stump, Dickwella backs away, punches to cover, and hares across to the other end
leg-stump ball, flicked away square through the leg side
Dickwella backs away outside leg, this is a 146ks missile in middle stump, he manages to diffuse it to cover
Dickwella shuffles across off, this is shortish and down the leg side. Dickwella misses the scoop. Why isn't that a leg-side wide? Not called
Dickwella jumps outside leg and pierces the gap at point. Head runs after the ball, dives at the edge of the boundary, and swats the ball in. Excellent fielding
Tharanga is rattled by pace. Nicked behind for a duck. Pace like fire, 146ks, swings away around off. Opens 'em up. Tharanga wafts and Paine gobbles up the edge
starts off with a wild leg-side wide. Paine makes a sprawling save behind the stumps
another leg-side wide
full and pings the pad in front of leg stump. I don't think it straightened enough. Stanlake's lbw appeal is nipped in the bud. Did that pitch outside leg too? The tracker returns three reds
Dickwella backs away outside leg and jabs to cover
Dickwella moves away outside leg, Stanlake follows him with a back of a length ball, which is swished over midwicket
140ks bouncer, aimed at the throat of Dickwella. He is unperturbed. He swats a pull over square leg
good length ball on middle, Dickwella goes low, pre-meditates a scoop. Think he got a bit of glove on it, does not carry to the keeper anyway
142.7ks, length and outside off, whistles past the outside edge
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted away to cover
Dickwella jumps outside leg, this is a 148.8ks yorker on middle. Dickwella manages to jam it out
Dickwella continues to venture outside the leg stump, this one leaps off the deck, and flies through to Paine
Dickwella moves outside leg and jams this yorker on leg stump
Dickwella moves outside leg again, takes this length ball on leg stump - 146ks - and pastes it over midwicket
half-volley on the stumps, which is belted straight past the bowler for four
Munaweera backs away outside leg, and smears this length ball from outside off over cover
three fours in a row for Munaweera. Four in a row for SL. He backs away outside leg, this is short on middle. He muscles it over extra-cover
Munaweera flits around the crease again. Flashed down to third man
good length and slanting away outside off, 145ks, too quick. Dickwella is beaten on the scoop. The brushes the helmet and carries to the keeper
wild short ball on the leg stump, flies over the scoop, flies over a leaping Paine
when it comes off, it looks incredible. Good length and outside off, he pre-meditates, goes low, and shovel-scoops it over short fine leg. It goes all the way. SL pillage 24 off the over
full on off, pushed back to the bowler
Munaweera dashes down the track, meets a half-volley, and drives it powerfully straight of mid-off
112.8ks, back of the hand slower ball outside off, Munaweera wafts and misses. Beaten by the change of pace
another slower ball outside off, beats the slash of Munaweera
one slower ball too many? Munaweera sits deep in the crease, waits for it, and pulls over square leg
full slower ball from the back of the hand, Dickwella steps away outside leg, swings and only connects with thin air
full and outside off, comes down the track, and carves a slower ball off an outside edge to the third man fence
short and seams back in, edged behind to the keeper
length ball on leg stump, clubbed away over backward square leg
full and veering into the pads, Munaweera picks it up and whips it over short fine leg. The runs continue to flow for SL
full-toss on off, pushed down to mid-off
yorker on middle, jabbed out to cover
starts off with a slider on middle, which is punched to the covers
pitches outside leg, spins, dips, and hits the pad. He did not pick the googly
goes low and paddles a single to short fine leg for one
slower legbreak outside off, Munaweera uses his feet. He reaches out and drives it past a diving cover
skiddy short ball on middle, punchily played on the back foot to cover
uses his feet and shovels a full ball to long-on
flat and full on the leg stump, swept away square of short fine leg
scoops a full ball in the air, but it drops in front of short fine leg
reverse-swept from middle stump to short third man
full on off, uses his feet and whips to deep midwicket
short of a length and angling across off, slapped away to deep cover
shimmies out, meets a full ball on off, and dinks it into the vacant spaces on the leg side. Attempts a double, but has to settle with one
tossed on the leg stump, knocked to vacant mid-on
dropped short and spins away outside off, chopped to point
slides on off, slogged to wide long-on
pushed through on middle, Dickwella stretches forward and reverse-swats it away from the stumps over a ducking square leg umpire. That's some shot
quick fizzer angled across the off stump. Dickwella looks to flick it over midwicket. He can only lob a leading edge into the hands of Klinger at short third man
looks like a googly, comes in, tickled away towards short fine leg
starts of with a 140ks short ball on off, swatted away through square leg
short on off, bursts off the pitch and thuds into the splice as the ball rolls to cover
keeps it short on off, worked away behind square on the leg side for one
back of a length and outside off now, Munaweera steps away and punches it stylishly over cover
shortish on off, swatted away to long leg
banged in short and down leg, left alone, wide
full and angled into the leg stump, deflected to fine leg
uses his feet, and nearly yorks himself. Squirted on the pitch
non-turning full ball on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
skids on off stump, no turn at all, leans back and cuts it crisply through backward point, to short third man's right. Just a single. Lax running

Zampa produces another breakthrough. Hip-high ball, half-tracker, on off stump, Munaweera pulls it flat to midwicket. Head-high catch for Finch. Munaweera played a half-hearted shot. Should have given it a proper thump. Wristspinners having a good day in Melbourne
worked from off stump to midwicket
tossed on off, tip-and-run single to cover
fullish on off stump, tapped to midwicket
Asela ventures across off, misses the sweep, and takes it on the pad outside the line
fractionally short on off stump, Siriwardana powers a pull to deep midwicket on the back foot
full on middle and leg, paddled away fine
wicket-to-wicket stuff, dabbed to cover with soft hands
short on leg stump, Asela swivels on the back foot and controls a pull to long leg

Finch throws himself to his left and nearly pulls off a stunner. Half-tracker on off stump, pulled away in the air. Finch dives swiftly at short midwicket but it does not stick. He saved three runs there
short and outside off, dragged in the air to the right of Finch now
tossed up and outside off, Siriwarana drives inside-out over the covers
tossed up and spins away outside off, googly. Siriwardana throws his bat at the ball and slices an outside edge over short third man
backs away outside leg and flashes the ball to sweeper cover. Impressive spell from Zampa
Shot. Asela runs down the track, meets a half-volley, and drives it in the air to the left of mid-off. Pristine timing
Tye retorts with a slippery short ball outside off, Asela shelves the hook
short on the leg stump, helped over the keeper's head
backs away outside leg, this is short, chasing him. Slashed in the direction of point
length ball outside off, Siriwardana sits deep in the crease, and tonks it straight of mid-off
117ks full slower ball outside off, hoodwinks Siriwardana, who was aiming downtown again
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and runs the ball down to deep third man
really full ball on the leg stump, clipped away through midwicket
dragged short and outside off, swatted on the back foot straight to midwicket
Asela steps away outside leg, Cummins does not get hold of the wide yorker. This is too full and outside off, slices it up and over backward point
length ball outside off, slower one, Asela can't ramp it behind
Asela ventures outside leg again, Cummins sends down a wide yorker, which is carved to deep third man
Asela is floored. Man down. He attempts a reverse-swat, this skiddy back of a length ball hits him on the box
just short of a good length and outside off, drags a pull to wide long-on
fuller and outside off, Asela makes room and carves it away square through the off side
Asela makes room again, back of a length and outside off, he carves again, this time in the air to the right of backward point
back-of-the-hand slower ball, too full on the leg stump, easily glanced away with fine leg inside the circle. Placed square of the fielder
leading edge, does not carry to mid-off. Full ball, holds up in the pitch or probably a slower ball. Asela looks to work it to the leg side, ends up chipping it straighter
wide yorker outside off, 145ks, Asela angles it away fine of deep third man. SL cruising
Asela jumps outside the leg stump, this banged short on the stumps, fizzes through to Paine
four boundaries in six balls for Asela. Short of a length and outside off, Asela ramps it in the air to the right of deep third man now. Celebrates his maiden T20I fifty
very full on the stumps, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball to deep midwicket
short of a length and outside off, 144.9ks, hurries Siriwardana for pace. The top-edged pull lands safely in the square-leg region
short and cramps Asela for room. Pulled down to long leg

Stumping chance. This looks tight. Sliding across off from around the stumps. Asela, stretching forward, attempts a reverse-sweep and misses. He loses his balance, and can't ground his bat in time. Good awareness from Paine. Maiden international wicket for Turner
full and attacking the front pad, worked away through square leg

Two wickets in three balls for the debutant. Pushed through flatter and quicker, Siriwardana plays back and is pinned in front of leg stump. Was it heading down leg? I am sure this is missing the stumps. The umpire doesn't think so, and raises his finger. The tracker suggests it was heading down
fizzing across off, beats the outside edge
short and angled across off, square-cut away. Sweeper runs (Henriques) across to his left, slides, and ends up escorting the ball to the boundary
dragged down outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover on the back foot
back of the hand slower ball outside off, 107ks, the batsman drives early and outside-edges it in front of the keeper
hip-high slower ball on the leg stump, pulled in the air over midwicket
back of the hand slower one again, this is too wide outside off. Past the tramline. Prasanna swishes and does not connect
full on middle and leg, tickled to short fine leg
more back of the hand stuff outside off, beats the cut
full-toss outside off, flashed to deep backward point
110.8ks slower ball on middle and leg, he eyes up the leg side and misses. The ball grazes the thigh and rolls to the off side
115.8ks slower short ball outside off, Prasanna swings early and can't touch it

118.2ks, shortish slower ball again. Prasanna pulls early again and can't touch it. Paine quickly hunts the ball down. The pair eye a bye. Paine ferries the ball to Tye, the bowler, who swipes the bails, but Prasanna is in
hip-high short ball on middle and leg, pulled away to long leg
116.8ks, slower short ball on the off stump, attempts a pull and squirts a bottom-edge to cover

slower short ball outside off, Kapu drags it over midwicket and hares across for the second. Wayward throw from the deep. Udana jumps off his seat in the SL dressing room. Kapu punches gloves with his partner
Kapugedara does it for Sri Lanka! Too full and outside off, he creams a drive through the covers and seals victory for the visitors
